results.title: The Common Cold
results.content:
Slipping across the window sill, Jacob stops suddenly at the edge, considering her options as she looks below. Her charm bracelet sits comfortably on her wrist bone, wavering solemnly in the western breeze. Khhha - she clears her throat gingerly, releasing a wizard’s puff of smoke into the air around her nose. Far below, she can sense the dew slipping hesitantly down a ridge of honeysuckle. The smell is sweet to her, stuck and stalking through the thick fog, rising to the warmer air above.

“Don’t listen,” she mutters, saying a silent prayer with her toes and fingernails. The bones in her collar quiver, delicate and uncommonly confident. Jacob holds an uncanny resemblance to her little sister; little in age and stature, but most certainly born first, in the way of the old rites. This would not often occur to her, but in such a moment as this one the mind is fragile and wavering, grasping for distant belongings.
